summary: Frontend testing of Boekhouding (Accounting) module completed. Fixed critical backend bug where Authorization header was not being extracted properly. All 5 main pages tested successfully after fix.

critical.issue: Authorization header not being extracted - was using 'authorization: str = None' instead of 'authorization: str = Header(None)'

Sidebar contains BOEKHOUDING module with all 14 sub-items (Dashboard, Grootboek, Debiteuren, Crediteuren, Bank/Kas, BTW, Verkoop, Inkoop, Voorraad, Vaste Activa, Projecten, Rapportages, Wisselkoersen, Instellingen)

critical_code_review_comments: Fixed: /app/backend/routers/boekhouding.py - Changed 'authorization: str = None' to 'authorization: str = Header(None)' for all 80 endpoints to properly extract Authorization header from HTTP requests

success_rate.backend: N/A (frontend only testing, but fixed backend bug)

seed_data_creation: Demo account has pre-seeded data including DSB Zakelijk bank account with SRD 10.000,00 balance
context_for_next_testing_agent: Boekhouding module fully functional after Authorization header fix. All 5 main pages (Dashboard, Grootboek, Debiteuren, Crediteuren, Bank/Kas) load correctly. Sidebar shows BOEKHOUDING module with 14 sub-items. Demo account has pre-seeded data.

rca_of_the_issue.root_cause: The boekhouding router was using 'authorization: str = None' as a function parameter, which doesn't automatically extract the Authorization header from HTTP requests. FastAPI requires using Header() dependency to extract headers.
reproduction_steps: 3. Observe 'Fout bij laden gegevens' error and 401 Unauthorized in console
rca_of_the_issue.mitigation: Changed all 80 endpoint signatures from 'authorization: str = None' to 'authorization: str = Header(None)' in /app/backend/routers/boekhouding.py
